cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /triage with feedback: 'The login page is broken on mobile (blank screen), the password reset email has a typo, and we need dark mode support.'

Demonstrate the workflow.

expectations.description: Creates exactly ONE task (not three separate tasks) with all findings organized in phased design
Organizes findings by phase: Phase 1 bugs (login blank screen), Phase 2 tasks (email typo), Phase 3 features (dark mode)
Does NOT read code files, edit code, or attempt to fix any of the reported issues — only creates the task

cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /triage with feedback: 'The search is slow'.

This is ambiguous — it could be a bug (regression), a feature request (add caching/indexing), or a chore (optimize existing queries). The feedback doesn't specify which.

Demonstrate how you handle this.

expectations.description: Identifies that 'search is slow' is ambiguous — could be classified as bug, feature, or chore depending on context the user hasn't provided
Uses AskUserQuestion to clarify classification before creating the task — wrong classification wastes downstream scope/develop effort
Does NOT just pick a classification and create the task without asking — the error handling section explicitly says to AskUserQuestion on ambiguous feedback
